basics.name: Austin McConnell
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am an enthusiastic Python software developer with a passion for automation and efficiency. My recent experience includes building an agent-based monitoring program, creating high-quality visualization dashboards using Bokeh and Seaborn, and exploring machine learning techniques. In my personal time, I like to compete in Kaggle competitions, maintain a Raspberry Pi media server and private cloud via owncloud at home. Also, I am studying Python best practices in order to improve my code. I am interested in local and remote Python positions. I have a security clearance from the US government.

work.summary: Lockheed Martin is a global aerospace company that is principally engaged in the research, design, development, manufacture, integration, and sustainment of military aircraft.
highlights: Created a multi-threaded and multi-processing agent-based file watcher program in Python for automation of simulation post processing. Multiple pipelines store processed results in a variety of formats and databases
Yougest Study Lead for contract deliverable. Output from the deliverable was used to directly support negotiation of a $1.9B annualized contract
Designed and implemented simulation excursions to explore the effects of proposed business expenditures on key sustainment metrics

Primary modeler in charge of massive 10 year global simulation which included planned squadron size and flight hours for US and partner countries, planned and actual spare part purchases, and engineered and actual failure rates for thousands of parts

work.position: Subsystems Integrity and Force Life Management Engineer
work.summary: Lockheed Martin is a global aerospace company that is principally engaged in the research, design, development, manufacture, integration, and sustainment of military aircraft.
highlights: Developed standalone software tool using Matlab to parse binary flight data and collect results for team use (~3000 lines of code)
Provided code design and data analysis for 6 part utilization reports
Applied statistical analysis to multiple dataset formats and used goodness-of-fit parameters to determine best curve fit option
Created Access database and reports to manage limited-life part inspection requirements
Reviewed qualification requirements and test reports for 4 F-35 subsystems

awards.title: Special Recognition Award
awards.summary: I was recognized for delivery of exceptional simulation results. Specifically, I incorporated actual spares demand and actual part failure data into the simulation model. This improvement increased confidence in the model results which lead to the results being used to support proposal and negotiation of a $1.9B annualized contract.

awards.title: Special Recognition Award
awards.summary: I was recognized for my efforts in fully-automating the process to run hundreds of simulations, post-process the output, and push results directly to a database. This enormously decreased turn-around time for model developments and enabled the team to provide top-level management support in a timely manner.

awards.title: Special Recognition Award
awards.summary: I was recognized for my efforts to develop a tool to automatically parse aircraft flight data and store the output in a centralized repository for use in other program tools. This reduced the time to get one signal from 60 minutes to essentially 1 sec as all signals were parsed and stored during the night and were ready for immediate use.

awards.title: Lowy Award
awards.summary: Awarded to top airplane design team for innovation, technical expertise and teamwork.
